--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "Gordon Mohr (Internet
Archive)" <gojomo@a...> wrote:
> robeger wrote:
> > Is there a way to have Heritrix create a different ARC file for each
> > of the seed URLs for a crawl?
> 
> No, that's not a current capability.
> 
> It sounds like it'd be an interesting addition. It might be tricky to
> define the the desired behavior for various situations where resources
> are referred-to across site boundaries.
> 
> For example: You might want different behaviors depending on whether
> your aim is for each ARC to be maximally self-contained (and separable
> from others), compared to if you were simply trying to group resources
> by hostnames/administrative domains.
> 
> We are unlikely to implement such options anytime soon, as it does
not match
> our typical usage. However, if you wanted to add this capability
yourself,
> we'd be happy to give advice/feedback on your proposal or
implementation,
> and if the result is of general use, we'd eagerly integrate it into the
> official releases.
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
